Imagine making your customers pay for crate keys when 95% of the people that play the game have spent money to buy the game itself
And then not letting them open it because they STILL have to pay for crate keys then you decide to make your game free to play.
Yet you make getting the crates free.
2 bucks a piece for a key? You're joking, right?
